title: Bahrain: Citibank Launches Premium Accounts
summary: Manama - Citibank, N.A., Bahrain's consumer business recently launched the Premium Account, a personalized solution with a touch of innovation.
tag-2: Manama – Citibank, N.A., Bahrain's consumer business recently launched the Premium Account, a personalized solution with a touch of innovation.
tag-3: Premium Accounts are short-term, currency-related investment accounts that provide multiple benefits and are tailor-made to suit a variety of clients' views and needs. Premium Accounts may offer higher interest rates whereby clients accept the possibility of receiving their principal plus interest back on maturity in either of the two currencies chosen at inception. The key elements of the choice of currencies, tenor (ranging from one week to three months) and conversion rate are all customized to suit the individual views of clients.
tag-4: Mazin Manna, CEO of Citi Bahrain, commented, "Premium Accounts provide our clients with an opportunity to earn a higher interest rate as compared to a conventional Time Deposit. Citibank is pleased to offer this innovative solution that has multiple benefits and serves clients with exposure to multiple currencies."
tag-5: Navneet Kampani, Consumer Bank Head for Bahrain, said, "We are finally able to offer an on-shore solution to clients, ranging from those operating their business all over the world to those with children studying abroad, while benefitting from higher interest rates. This is an ideal product for investors who are trying to counter the low interest-rate environment that we find ourselves in today."
tag-6: Citi has been in the Middle East for nearly 50 years and currently offers consumer-banking services in Bahrain, UAE and Egypt. In the Kingdom of Bahrain alone, Citibank, N.A., being a wholly owned entity of Citi and providing consumer banking services as well, has had a presence for the past 21 years.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
